title: 3 Easy Ways to Find the Name of Your Computer

steps.title: Press ⊞ Win+I.
steps.content: Press ⊞ Win + I . This keyboard shortcut will open Settings. You can also launch this menu by clicking the gear icon in the Start menu.

steps.title: Click System.
steps.content: Click System . If you're using Windows 11, this is an option in the panel on the left side of the window. If you're using Windows 10, you'll see this centered in the window.

steps.title: Click About (Windows 10 only).
steps.content: Click About (Windows 10 only). Skip this step if you have Windows 11.

steps.title: Find your computer's name.
steps.content: Find your computer's name. It'll be under "Device specifications" or at the top of the window. You'll also see information like your processor, installed RAM, and your device ID . Click Rename PC if you want to change the name . You can also see the same information in the Control Panel under "System & security > System." For Windows 8, press Win + X and click "System" to see your computer's name. For Windows 7, go to the Start menu, right-click Computer and click Properties . See the computer's name there. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Open System Settings.
steps.content: Open System Settings. Click the Apple logo in the Apple menu, then click System Settings.

steps.title: Click General.
steps.content: Click General . It's next to a gear icon.

steps.title: Click About.
steps.content: Click About . It's an option on the left side of the window and might be active by default.

steps.title: See your computer's name.
steps.content: See your computer's name. You'll see information about your computer listed here. [2] X Research source You can also get here by clicking Apple > About This Mac > More Info .

steps.title: Open System Preferences.
steps.content: Open System Preferences. Click the Apple logo in the Apple menu, then click System Preferences .

steps.title: Click Sharing.
steps.content: Click Sharing . It's next to a file icon that has a gear on it.

steps.title: Find your computer's name.
steps.content: Find your computer's name. You'll see this at the top of the menu. [3] X Research source
